chapter.title: Tasks
chapter.para: Tasks are the lowest unit in the Job hierarchy, and running a Task is the primary purpose of running a Job. There purpose is to run one or more commands, and then collect the results of those commands in a way that other entities can access them.

section.title: Task Searching
section.para: To search for a Task, go to Scheduler->Task Library on the menu at the top of the page. The default search is on the Name property, with the contains operator. See for search details.
Once you've found a particular Task, you can see it's details by clicking on the Link in the Name column.
It's also possible to search on the history of the running of Tasks. This is made possible by the Executed Tasks search. It's accesable from the page.

section.title: Adding a new Task
section.para: To add a Task which has already been packaged, click on the Scheduler menu and then New Task. You will need to click on Browse to locate your Task, and then add it with the Submit Data button.

section.title: Task Details
section.para:
The details of a Task consist of the following
Description
Path This is where the source of the test will reside after it's installed on a machine during a Task run
Expected Time The time the Task is expected to run for
Creation Date
Updated Date
Version
License
Types
RPM
Run For
Requires
